classSpec.desc: provides attributes for defining a mathematical formula.

attDef.gloss: holds a numeric value designated for use in a mathematical calculation.
attDef.desc: An formula is provided for a numeric value necessary for a mathematical calculation such as a conversion between measurement systems.

unitDef.label: stadium
unitDef.desc: The stadium was a Roman unit of linear measurement equivalent to 625 pedes, or Roman feet.

remarks.p: This attribute class provides formula for use in defining a value used in mathematical calculation. It can be used, for example, to store a value needed to convert from from one system of measurement to another. In our simple examples, the values are additive: three teaspoons make a tablespoon. The formula attribute does not itself hold a formula, but rather a numerical value necessary for a conversion or other mathematical process documented elsewhere.
